meanings.definition: The ability of a molecule or atom to become polarized in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the polarizabilities of different molecules in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use polarizabilities to understand how atoms react to electric fields.
meanings.sent3: The polarizabilities of the tiny particles made them dance in the electric field.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the polarizabilities of a charged atom, easily influenced by external forces.
meanings.sent5: The concept of polarizabilities is like a molecule's flexibility in an electric world.

meanings.definition: The measure of the ease with which the electron cloud of an atom or molecule can be distorted by an external electric field.
meanings.sent1: The polarizabilities of the atom determined its response to the electric field.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use polarizabilities to quantify how atoms react to electric fields.
meanings.sent3: The electron cloud's polarizabilities made it the life of the electric field party.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas had the polarizabilities of an electron cloud, easily swayed by external influences.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing polarizabilities is like watching the dance of electrons in an electric field.
